text: The Laguna Copperplate Inscription is a document marked on a copper plate in 900 AD and found in Laguna, Philippines. The document is written in Old Malay language using Kawi script. It was translated by Antoon Postma (a Dutch anthropologist) in 1992. It is evidence of ancient kingdoms of Medang, Sri Vijaya, Tondo, and others.(2010-05-07). "Laguna Copperplate Inscription" . All Philippines. Retrieved on November 17, 2011.Tiongson, Jaime F. (August 8, 2010). "Laguna Copperplate Inscription: A New Interpretation Using Early Tagalog Dictionaries" . Bayang Pinagpala. Retrieved on 2011-11-18. == References == Category:History of the Philippines Category:Documents Category:900 Category:Laguna (province)
title: Laguna Copperplate Inscription
